dublin_core.dcvalue: We evaluated the use of videophone technology to provide directly observed therapy DOT to patients with active tuberculosis During 304 treatment doses adherence on videophone DOT was 95 and patient acceptance of the technology was excellent In selected cases the use of videophone technology can maintain a high level of adherence to DOT in a cost effective manner
Clinical infectious diseases : an official publication of the Infectious Diseases Society of America
The application of telemedicine technology to a directly observed therapy program for tuberculosis: a pilot project.
